name: Plain Sight
description: Plain Sight is a multiplayer arcade game about suicidal ninja robots. Fly through space, leap over planetoids and destroy opponents with your trusty katana. Killing fellow robots lets you steal their tasty, tasty energy. Packed with spinach-like goodness; energy makes you bigger, stronger, faster and generally more awesome.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows XP Processor: 2 ghz or better Memory: 1 GB RAM Graphics: Shader model 2 supported graphics card DirectX®:DirectX 9 Hard Drive: 300 MB of free space Sound: Sound card required

reviews.review_text: This was the first game I ever got on Steam. IN FACT...it was the game that my friend told me he was gifting to me, which meant I had to install Steam. Ah, I'm so glad I did. :D #nostalgia #thankyouLordDust  AS for the game, it's a third-person suicidal robot simulator. You go around slicing up other robots with your sword and then when you want your kills to COUNT, you have to self-distruct yourself.  Sounds simple, right? Well, it would be if it weren't for the fact you can run on walls, ceilings, etc. Basically any surface on the map you automagically cling to it. The 'bound/unbound' mechanic takes a little bit to get used to, but it's a unique game & one I recommend at least TRYING once in your life.  *edit [12/21/15]: I just heard multiplayer servers are down. :( I don't know much else, but if MP comes back in any way, I'll update*

If you are ever looking for a bit of rapid-fire action with a very dynamic game-field, Plain Sight can provide. You kill a lot, you die even more. But it's okay. In fact it's perfect. Controls are simple and intuitive, and gameplay concepts are fairly easy to understand. The learning curve can be a bit steep (the bare-bones tutorial doesn't give much away) but figuring out good tactics is half the fun.  However, the game requires a solid internet connection, because multiplayer is the only way to go, and lag can ruin you effortlessly. As well, the multiplayer community isn't perpetually online, so whether or not you can set up the exhilariting large matches is hit-and-miss.

SPACE NINJAS! Robot Ninjas. ROBOT NINJAS IN SPACE! Challenge your friends and their reflexes. Utilize torn up terrains and odd gravity wells, soar through space and outsmart opponents, ready to slice them open with a one-hit-crit in this high stakes combat game. But it's not just about landing kills. It's about building up a killstreak greater than your last in order to obtain more points and more power in the end. Great for LAN parties and fanatics of ninja clicks and killstreak boasting. Technically you could call this a third person melee game.
